content:
TITLE: Creating Admin User for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to create an administrative user account through the panel's CLI interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose exec panel php artisan p:user:make
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Essential Environment Variables for Pyrodactyl Migration
DESCRIPTION: List of critical environment variables that need to be copied from the Pterodactyl .env file to the Pyrodactyl docker-compose.yml configuration. These variables maintain database connectivity and application identity during migration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
APP_KEY
APP_URL
DB_CONNECTION
DB_HOST
DB_PORT
DB_DATABASE
DB_USERNAME
DB_PASSWORD
HASHIDS_SALT
HASHIDS_LENGTH (if it's not 8)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading and Extracting Pyrodactyl Release
DESCRIPTION: Command to download the latest Pyrodactyl release from GitHub and extract it directly to the current directory. This overwrites the existing Pterodactyl files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -L https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl/releases/latest/download/panel.tar.gz | tar -xzv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Pyrodactyl Panel with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize and start the Pyrodactyl panel in detached mode using Docker Compose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose up -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Database Migrations for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to run database migrations with seed data and force option. This updates the database schema to be compatible with Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan migrate --seed --force
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Docker Image from Pterodactyl to Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: A simple diff showing how to switch from the standard Pterodactyl Docker image to the Pyrodactyl image. This involves replacing the ghcr.io/pterodactyl/panel:latest image with ghcr.io/pyrohost/pyrodactyl:main in your Docker configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/index.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
-image: ghcr.io/pterodactyl/panel:latest
+image: ghcr.io/pyrohost/pyrodactyl:main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading Latest Pyrodactyl Release in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to download and extract the latest Pyrodactyl release from GitHub. This fetches the panel.tar.gz archive and unpacks it directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -L https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl/releases/latest/download/panel.tar.gz | tar -xzv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Wings Docker Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create directory, download Wings docker-compose template, and start the Wings service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir pyrodactyl-wings && cd pyrodactyl-wings
wget https://github.com/pterodactyl/wings/raw/develop/docker-compose.example.yml -O docker-compose.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Docker Image from Pterodactyl to Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: This diff shows how to modify your docker-compose.yml file to change the container image from Pterodactyl to Pyrodactyl. The change involves replacing the Pterodactyl GitHub image with the Pyrodactyl equivalent.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
-image: ghcr.io/pterodactyl/panel:latest
+image: ghcr.io/pyrohost/pyrodactyl:main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Wings Container Status
DESCRIPTION: Command to check if the Wings container is running properly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker ps | grep wings
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PHP Dependencies for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to install PHP dependencies using Composer with optimizations for production. This ensures all required libraries are available for Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PHP Dependencies with Composer
DESCRIPTION: Command to install PHP dependencies using Composer with production-optimized settings. The --no-dev flag excludes development dependencies, and --optimize-autoloader improves class loading performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Frontend Assets for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Node.js dependencies and build the frontend assets for production, followed by setting appropriate permissions again. This prepares the user interface for Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm ci && npm run ship
chmod -R 755 storage/* bootstrap/cache/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Building Frontend Assets
DESCRIPTION: Command to install frontend dependencies using npm and build the production assets. The 'ship' script compiles and optimizes JavaScript and CSS assets for production use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm ci && npm run ship
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Database Migrations in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute database migrations and seeders with the --force flag to run in production. This updates the database schema and populates any new required data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan migrate --seed --force
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Proper File Permissions for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to set appropriate permissions on storage and cache directories. This ensures the web server can write to these directories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod -R 755 storage/* bootstrap/cache
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Pyrodactyl Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize and start the Pyrodactyl panel in detached mode using Docker Compose. This launches all defined services in the docker-compose.yml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose up -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Maintenance Mode for Pterodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to put the Pterodactyl panel into maintenance mode before migration. This prevents users from accessing the panel during the migration process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan down
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Maintenance Mode in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: Command to put the Pyrodactyl application into maintenance mode using Laravel's Artisan CLI. This prevents users from accessing the application during the update process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan down
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Web Server Ownership for Pyrodactyl Files
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the ownership of all panel files to the web server user (www-data). This ensures the web server has proper access to all files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/pterodactyl/*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting File Ownership for Web Servers in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set the appropriate ownership of files based on the web server being used. Examples are provided for NGINX, NGINX on CentOS, and Apache on CentOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# For NGINX (non-CentOS)
chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/pterodactyl/*

# For NGINX on CentOS
chown -R nginx:nginx /var/www/pterodactyl/*

# For Apache on CentOS
chown -R apache:apache /var/www/pterodactyl/*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clearing Cached Views and Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clear cached views and configuration in Laravel. This ensures that old Pterodactyl views and configurations don't conflict with Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan view:clear
php artisan config:clear
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clearing Application Cache in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clear the Laravel view and configuration caches. This ensures that any changes to views or configuration files are reflected after the update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan view:clear
php artisan config:clear
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Wings Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Wings service in detached mode using Docker Compose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker compose up -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Maintenance Mode for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to bring the panel back online after migration. This makes the migrated Pyrodactyl panel accessible to users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Maintenance Mode in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: Command to disable maintenance mode and bring the application back online after the update process is complete. This allows users to access the updated application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Restarting Laravel Queue Worker for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to restart the Laravel queue worker. This ensures that background tasks will run properly with the new Pyrodactyl codebase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan queue:restart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Restarting Queue Worker in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: Command to restart the Laravel queue worker which processes background jobs. This ensures that the worker is using the updated code after the update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan queue:restart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: UFW Firewall Configuration for Wings
DESCRIPTION: Commands to allow necessary ports through UFW firewall for Wings operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ufw allow 2022
ufw allow 8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: IPTables Firewall Configuration for Wings
DESCRIPTION: Commands to allow necessary ports through IPTables firewall for Wings operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 8080 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 2022 -j ACCEPT
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Version Manager for Pyrodactyl Migration
DESCRIPTION: Command to install fnm (Fast Node Manager) for managing Node.js versions during the Pyrodactyl migration process. This installs the version manager to your system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -o- https://fnm.vercel.app/install | bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js Version Manager (fnm) in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the fnm (Fast Node Manager) tool which helps manage Node.js versions. This is a prerequisite for updating Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -o- https://fnm.vercel.app/install | bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js 22 Using fnm for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Node.js version 22 using the fnm (Fast Node Manager). This ensures the correct Node.js version is available for Pyrodactyl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fnm install 22
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js 22 via fnm in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Node.js version 22 using the fnm version manager. This specific version is required for the Pyrodactyl update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fnm install 22
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Permissions for Cache and Storage in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the proper read, write, and execute permissions (755) for storage directories and bootstrap cache. This ensures the application can write to these locations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod -R 755 storage/* bootstrap/cache
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing Permission Issues After Update
DESCRIPTION: Commands to correct permission issues that might occur after updating. This sets the correct file permissions and ownership for storage and cache directories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod -R 755 storage/* bootstrap/cache/
chown -R www-data:www-data storage bootstrap/cache
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Email Configuration Variables for Pyrodactyl
DESCRIPTION: Optional email-related environment variables that should be transferred if email functionality is configured in the original Pterodactyl installation. These settings maintain email functionality after migration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
MAIL_MAILER
MAIL_HOST
MAIL_PORT
MAIL_USERNAME
MAIL_PASSWORD
MAIL_ENCRYPTION
MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS
MAIL_FROM_NAME
APP_SERVICE_AUTHOR
MAIL_DRIVER
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying Directory Permissions in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to verify and set the proper permissions (755) for storage directories and bootstrap cache. This ensures the application can write to these locations after the update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod -R 755 storage/* bootstrap/cache/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Pterodactyl Installation Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to change into the Pterodactyl panel installation directory. This assumes Pterodactyl is installed in the standard location.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-to-native.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /var/www/pterodactyl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Pyrodactyl Installation Directory in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory to the Pyrodactyl installation location. This is necessary before performing update operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /path/to/your/pyrodactyl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clearing Application Cache for Troubleshooting
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clear Laravel view and configuration caches when troubleshooting hydration mismatch errors. This ensures all templates and configurations are freshly loaded.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
php artisan view:clear
php artisan config:clear
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rebuilding Frontend Assets for Hydration Issues
DESCRIPTION: Command to reinstall Node.js dependencies and rebuild frontend assets when encountering hydration mismatch errors. This ensures client and server-rendered content match.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/migrations/native-update.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm ci && npm run ship
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Next.js Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands for launching the development server using different package managers (npm, pnpm, or yarn). The server will be accessible at http://localhost:3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
yarn dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install project dependencies using NPM package manager
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Application
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the application, cache results, and upload sourcemaps to Sentry
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run ship
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Nix Development Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Nix development environment
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
nix run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Vagrant Environment
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize and start the Vagrant environment
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
vagrant up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Environment File with Nix
DESCRIPTION: Command to copy the Nix environment template to create a new environment file
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp .env.nix .env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Managing NFS Server Service
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start and enable NFS server service on boot
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Start the service
sudo systemctl start nfs-server

# Enable on boot
sudo systemctl enable nfs-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Documentation Structure
DESCRIPTION: Basic markdown structure defining the documentation page for community installation guides, including frontmatter metadata, headings, links, and a callout component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/installation-guides.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
---
title: Community Installation Guides
description: Community-contributed guides for installing Pyrodactyl on different platforms
---

# Community Installation Guides

This section contains various installation guides for Pyrodactyl, including both official and community-contributed methods.

## Official Installation

For the official Docker-based installation method, see our [Installation Guide](/docs/installation).

## Community Guides

These guides are contributed by the community and may offer alternative installation methods or platform-specific instructions:

### Platform-Specific

- [Coolify Installation Guide](https://jxtq.moe/guides/pyrodactyl-coolify) - Guide for installing Pyrodactyl using Coolify

<Callout type="note">
Want to contribute a guide? Feel free to submit it through a pull request, share it in our GitHub Discussions, or join our Discord community at [https://discord.gg/FGWKZT5dxv](https://discord.gg/FGWKZT5dxv) for support!
</Callout>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NFS Utils on Fedora
DESCRIPTION: Command to install NFS utilities on Fedora systems
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo dnf install nfs-utils
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NFS Utils on Ubuntu/Debian
DESCRIPTION: Command to install NFS kernel server on Ubuntu/Debian systems
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt-get install nfs-kernel-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Vagrant with Sudo
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Vagrant with elevated privileges
SOURCE: https://github.com/pyrohost/pyrodactyl-docs/blob/main/content/docs/local-development.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo vagrant up
```
